title: Optimal Conditions for Key Digestive Enzymes

content.description:
Figure 1. Activity levels of two digestive enzymes over a range of <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

Trypsin and pepsin are enzymes that function in different areas of the digestive tract. One functions in the stomach, where the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is between <math alttext="1.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, while the other functions in the small intestines, where the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is between <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following best describes where each enzyme functions?

choices.label: Pepsin works in the intestines because the optimal <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for pepsin is basic.
Trypsin works in the stomach because the optimal <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for trypsin is basic.
Pepsin works in the stomach because the optimal <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for pepsin is acidic.
Trypsin works in the stomach because the optimal <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for trypsin is acidic.

content.answer: Pepsin works in the stomach because the optimal <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for pepsin is acidic.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
